How do I mount a cd-drive from the temin: I installed from the drive, but it doesn't auto mount
cat /etc/fstab and find your cdrom device (if it's detected; it should be there)
Does it make any difference that it is a usb drive?
tail -f /var/log/messages and plug the USB, it'll show you the device, if not; try tail -f /var/log/dmesg
But under options it says " noauto"???
if it's a CDROM, you can mount it: mount /media/cdrom
tell me, are you trying to mount a IDE CDROM or something else
tail gives "localhost kernel: [4367323.146000]  usb 4-3: new high speed USB device using ehci_hcd and address 24"
vi the file and check that message block; it should give you the device name
edit (vi) your log files (/var/log/messages,dmesg) and search for the device name
do this; tail -f /var/log/messages /var/log/dmesg; plug out the USB, and plug it back in .. it should show you the device
